summary.long: Acts is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: In my first book, Theophilus, I wrote about what Yeshua began to do and teach. This included everything from the beginning of his life
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the day he was taken to heaven. Before he was taken to heaven, he gave instructions through the Holy Spirit to the apostles, whom he had chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After his death Yeshua showed the apostles a lot of convincing evidence that he was alive. For 40 days he appeared to them and talked with them about the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once, while he was meeting with them, he ordered them not to leave Jerusalem but to wait there for what the Father had promised. Yeshua said to them, “I’ve told you what the Father promises:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John baptized with water, but in a few days you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the apostles came together, they asked him, “Lord, is this the time when you’re going to restore the kingdom to Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told them, “You don’t need to know about times or periods that the Father has determined by his own authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes to you. Then you will be my witnesses to testify about me in Jerusalem, throughout Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had said this, he was taken to heaven. A cloud hid him so that they could no longer see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were staring into the sky as he departed. Suddenly, two men in white clothes stood near them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked, “Why are you men from Galilee standing here looking at the sky? Yeshua, who was taken from you to heaven, will come back in the same way that you saw him go to heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called the Mount of Olives. It is near Jerusalem, about half a mile away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came into the city, Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James (son of Alphaeus), Simon the Zealot, and Judas (son of James) went to the second-story room where they were staying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles had a single purpose as they devoted themselves to prayer. They were joined by some women, including Mary (the mother of Yeshua), and they were joined by his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At a time when about 120 disciples had gathered together, Peter got up and spoke to them.
He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brothers, what the Holy Spirit predicted through David in Scripture about Judas had to come true. Judas led the men to arrest Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had been one of us and had been given an active role in this ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the money he received from the wrong he had done, he bought a piece of land where he fell headfirst to his death. His body split open, and all his internal organs came out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone living in Jerusalem knows about this. They even call that piece of land Akeldama, which means ‘Field of Blood’ in their dialect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You’ve read in Psalms, ‘Let his home be deserted, and let no one live there,’ and ‘Let someone else take his position.’”
“Therefore, someone must be added to our number to serve with us as a witness that Yeshua came back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must be one of the men who accompanied Yeshua with us the entire time that the Lord Yeshua was among us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This person must have been with us from the time that John was baptizing people to the day that Yeshua was taken from us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples determined that two men were qualified. These men were Joseph (who was called Barsabbas and was also known as Justus) and Matthias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they prayed, “Lord, you know everyone’s thoughts. Show us which of these two you have chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show us who is to take the place of Judas as an apostle, since Judas abandoned his position to go to the place where he belongs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They drew names to choose an apostle. Matthias was chosen and joined the eleven apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pentecost, the fiftieth day after Passover, came, all the believers were together in one place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, a sound like a violently blowing wind came from the sky and filled the whole house where they were staying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tongues that looked like fire appeared to them. The tongues arranged themselves so that one came to rest on each believer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the believers were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other languages as the Spirit gave them the ability to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Devout Jewish men from every nation were living in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gathered when they heard the wind. Each person was startled to recognize his own dialect when the disciples spoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stunned and amazed, the people in the crowd said, “All of these men who are speaking are Galileans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do we hear them speaking in our native dialects?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We’re Parthians, Medes, and Elamites. We’re people from Mesopotamia, Judea, Cappadocia, Pontus, the province of Asia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, and the country near Cyrene in Libya. We’re Jewish people, converts to Judaism, and visitors from Rome,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crete, and Arabia. We hear these men in our own languages as they tell about the miracles that God has done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of these devout men were stunned and puzzled. They asked each other, “What can this mean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said jokingly, “They’re drunk on sweet wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter stood up with the eleven apostles. In a loud voice he said to them, “Men of Judea and everyone living in Jerusalem! You must understand this, so pay attention to what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These men are not drunk as you suppose. It’s only nine in the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, this is what the prophet Joel spoke about:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘In the last days, God says,
    I will pour my Spirit on everyone.
        Your sons and daughters will speak what God has revealed.
        Your young men will see visions.
        Your old men will dream dreams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In those days
    I will pour my Spirit on my servants, on both men and women.
        They will speak what God has revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will work miracles in the sky and give signs on the earth:
    blood, fire, and clouds of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun will become dark,
    and the moon will become as red as blood
        before the terrifying day of the Lord comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then whoever calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men of Israel, listen to what I say: Yeshua from Nazareth was a man whom God brought to your attention. You know that through this man God worked miracles, did amazing things, and gave signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By using men who don’t acknowledge Moses’ Teachings, you crucified Yeshua, who was given over to death by a plan that God had determined in advance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God brought him from death back to life and destroyed the pains of death, because death had no power to hold him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what David meant when he said about Yeshua:
‘I always see the Lord in front of me.
    I cannot be moved because he is by my side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices.
    My body also rests securely
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because you do not abandon my soul to the grave
    or allow your holy one to decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You make the path of life known to me.
    In your presence there is complete joy.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brothers, I can tell you confidently that our ancestor David died and was buried and that his tomb is here to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was a prophet and knew that God had promised with an oath that he would place one of David’s descendants on his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David knew that the Messiah would come back to life, and he spoke about that before it ever happened. He said that the Messiah wouldn’t be left in the grave and that his body wouldn’t decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “God brought this man Yeshua back to life. We are all witnesses to that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God used his power to give Yeshua the highest position. Yeshua has also received and has poured out the Holy Spirit as the Father had promised, and this is what you’re seeing and hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David didn’t go up to heaven, but he said,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
    “Take my highest position of power
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I put your enemies under your control.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All the people of Israel should know beyond a doubt that God made Yeshua, whom you crucified, both Lord and Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people heard this, they were deeply upset. They asked Peter and the other apostles, “Brothers, what should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter answered them, “All of you must turn to God and change the way you think and act, and each of you must be baptized in the name of Yeshua Christ so that your sins will be forgiven. Then you will receive the Holy Spirit as a gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This promise belongs to you and to your children and to everyone who is far away. It belongs to everyone who worships the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said much more to warn them. He urged, “Save yourselves from this corrupt generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who accepted what Peter said were baptized. That day about 3,000 people were added to the group.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were devoted to the teachings of the apostles, to fellowship, to the breaking of bread, and to prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A feeling of fear came over everyone as many amazing things and miraculous signs happened through the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the believers kept meeting together, and they shared everything with each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From time to time, they sold their property and other possessions and distributed the money to anyone who needed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The believers had a single purpose and went to the temple every day. They were joyful and humble as they ate at each other’s homes and shared their food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the same time, they praised God and had the good will of all the people. Every day the Lord saved people, and they were added to the group.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter and John were going to the temple courtyard for the three o’clock prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the same time, a man who had been lame from birth was being carried by some men. Every day these men would put the lame man at a gate in the temple courtyard. The gate was called Beautiful Gate. There he would beg for handouts from people going into the courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the man saw that Peter and John were about to go into the courtyard, he asked them for a handout.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter and John stared at him. “Look at us!” Peter said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man watched them closely. He expected to receive something from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Peter said to him, “I don’t have any money, but I’ll give you what I do have. Through the power of Yeshua Christ from Nazareth, walk!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter took hold of the man’s right hand and began to help him up. Immediately, the man’s feet and ankles became strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Springing to his feet, he stood up and started to walk. He went with Peter and John into the temple courtyard. The man was walking, jumping, and praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people saw him walking and praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They knew that he was the man who used to sit and beg at the temple’s Beautiful Gate. The people were amazed and stunned to see what had happened to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were excited, and everyone ran to see them at the place called Solomon’s Porch. The man wouldn’t let go of Peter and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter saw this, he said to the people, “Men of Israel, why are you amazed about this man? Why are you staring at us as though we have made him walk by our own power or godly life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of our ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob has glorified his servant Yeshua. You handed Yeshua over to Pilate. You rejected him in Pilate’s presence, even though Pilate had decided to let him go free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You rejected the man who was holy and innocent. You asked to have a murderer given to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you killed the source of life. But God brought him back to life, and we are witnesses to that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We believe in the one named Yeshua. Through his power alone this man, whom you know, was healed, as all of you saw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now, brothers, I know that like your rulers you didn’t know what you were doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in this way God made the sufferings of his Messiah come true. God had predicted these sufferings through all the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So change the way you think and act, and turn to God to have your sins removed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then times will come when the Lord will refresh you. He will send you Yeshua, whom he has appointed to be the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven must receive Yeshua until the time when everything will be restored as God promised through his holy prophets long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moses said, ‘The Lord your God will send you a prophet, an Israelite like me. Listen to everything he tells you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who won’t listen to that prophet will be excluded from the people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Samuel and all the prophets who followed him spoke about these days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are the descendants of the prophets and the heirs of the promise that God made to our ancestors when he said to Abraham, ‘Through your descendant all people on earth will be blessed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has brought his servant back to life and has sent him to you first. God did this to bless you by turning every one of you from your evil ways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some priests, the officer in charge of the temple guards, and some Sadducees approached Peter and John while they were speaking to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These religious authorities were greatly annoyed. Peter and John were teaching the people and spreading the message that the dead will come back to life through Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the temple guards arrested them. Since it was already evening, they put Peter and John in jail until the next day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many of those who had heard the message became believers, so the number of men who believed grew to about 5,000.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day the Jewish rulers, the leaders, and the experts in Moses’ Teachings met in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priest Annas, Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and the rest of the chief priest’s family were present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made Peter and John stand in front of them and then asked, “By what power or in whose name did you do this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter, because he was filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers and leaders of the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: today you are cross-examining us about the good we did for a crippled man. You want to know how he was made well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You and all the people of Israel must understand that this man stands in your presence with a healthy body because of the power of Yeshua Christ from Nazareth. You crucified Yeshua Christ, but God has brought him back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the stone that the builders rejected, the stone that has become the cornerstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one else can save us. Indeed, we can be saved only by the power of the one named Yeshua and not by any other person.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they found out that Peter and John had no education or special training, they were surprised to see how boldly they spoke. They realized that these men had been with Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw the man who was healed standing with Peter and John, they couldn’t say anything against the two apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they ordered Peter and John to leave the council room and began to discuss the matter among themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “What should we do to these men? Clearly, they’ve performed a miracle that everyone in Jerusalem knows about. We can’t deny that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So let’s threaten them. Let’s tell them that they must never speak to anyone about the one named Yeshua. Then the news about the miracle that they have performed will not spread any further among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They called Peter and John and ordered them never to teach about Yeshua or even mention his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter and John answered them, “Decide for yourselves whether God wants people to listen to you rather than to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We cannot stop talking about what we’ve seen and heard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The authorities threatened them even more and then let them go. Since all the people were praising God for what had happened, the authorities couldn’t find any way to punish Peter and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The man who was healed by this miracle was over 40 years old.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter and John were released, they went to the other apostles and told them everything the chief priests and leaders had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the apostles heard this, they were united and loudly prayed to God, “Master, you made the sky, the land, the sea, and everything in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You said through the Holy Spirit, who spoke through your servant David (our ancestor),
‘Why do the nations act arrogantly?
    Why do their people devise useless plots?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kings take their stand.
    Rulers make plans together
        against the Lord and against his Messiah.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In this city Herod and Pontius Pilate made plans together with non-Jewish people and the people of Israel. They made their plans against your holy servant Yeshua, whom you anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through your will and power, they did everything that you had already decided should be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord, pay attention to their threats now, and allow us to speak your word boldly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show your power by healing, performing miracles, and doing amazing things through the power and the name of your holy servant Yeshua.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the apostles had finished praying, their meeting place shook. All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and continued to speak the word of God boldly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole group of believers lived in harmony. No one called any of his possessions his own. Instead, they shared everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With great power the apostles continued to testify that the Lord Yeshua had come back to life. God’s abundant good will was with all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of them needed anything. From time to time, people sold land or houses and brought the money
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the apostles. Then the money was distributed to anyone who needed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph, a descendant of Levi, had been born on the island of Cyprus. The apostles called him Barnabas, which means “a person who encourages.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had some land. He sold it and turned the money over to the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man named Ananias and his wife Sapphira sold some property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They agreed to hold back some of the money they had pledged and turned only part of it over to the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter asked, “Ananias, why did you let Satan fill you with the idea that you could deceive the Holy Spirit? You’ve held back some of the money you received for the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While you had the land, it was your own. After it was sold, you could have done as you pleased with the money. So how could you do a thing like this? You didn’t lie to people but to God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Ananias heard Peter say this, he dropped dead. Everyone who heard about his death was terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some young men got up, wrapped his body in a sheet, carried him outside, and buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About three hours later Ananias’ wife arrived. She didn’t know what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Peter asked her, “Tell me, did you sell the land for that price?”
She answered, “Yes, that was the price.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said to her, “How could you and your husband agree to test the Lord’s Spirit? Those who buried your husband are standing at the door, and they will carry you outside for burial.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, she dropped dead in front of Peter. When the young men came back, they found Sapphira dead. So they carried her outside and buried her next to her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole church and everyone else who heard about what had happened were terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people saw the apostles perform many miracles and do amazing things. The believers had a common faith in Yeshua as they met on Solomon’s Porch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the other people dared to join them, although everyone spoke highly of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: More men and women than ever began to believe in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, people carried their sick into the streets. They placed them on stretchers and cots so that at least Peter’s shadow might fall on some sick people as he went by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crowds from the cities around Jerusalem would gather. They would bring their sick and those who were troubled by evil spirits, and each person was cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priest and the whole party of the Sadducees who were with him were extremely jealous. So they took action
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by arresting the apostles and putting them in the city jail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at night an angel from the Lord opened the doors to their cell and led them out of the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel told them, “Stand in the temple courtyard, and tell the people everything about life in Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Early in the morning, after they had listened to the angel, the apostles went into the temple courtyard and began to teach.
The chief priest and those who were with him called together the Jewish council, that is, all the leaders of Israel. They also sent men to the prison to get the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the temple guards arrived at the prison, they didn’t find the apostles. The guards came back and reported,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We found the prison securely locked and the guards standing at the doors. However, when we opened the doors, we found no one inside.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the officer of the temple guards and the chief priests heard this, they were puzzled about what could have happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then someone told them, “The men you put in prison are standing in the temple courtyard. They’re teaching the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officer of the temple guards went with some of his men to bring back the apostles without using force. After all, the officer and his guards were afraid that the people would stone them to death for using force.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they brought back the apostles, they made them stand in front of the council. The chief priest questioned them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “We gave you strict orders not to mention Yeshua’s name when you teach. Yet, you’ve filled Jerusalem with your teachings. You want to take revenge on us for putting that man to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter and the other apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You murdered Yeshua by hanging him on a cross. But the God of our ancestors brought him back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God used his power to give Yeshua the highest position as leader and savior. He did this to lead the people of Israel to him, to change the way they think and act, and to forgive their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are witnesses to these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men on the council heard this, they became furious and wanted to execute the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel stood up. He was a highly respected expert in Moses’ Teachings. He ordered that the apostles should be taken outside for a little while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the council, “Men of Israel, consider carefully what you do with these men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some time ago Theudas appeared. He claimed that he was important, and about four hundred men joined him. He was killed, and all his followers were scattered. The whole movement was a failure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After that man, at the time of the census, Judas from Galilee appeared and led people in a revolt. He, too, died, and all his followers were scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We should keep away from these men for now. We should leave them alone. I can guarantee that if the plan they put into action is of human origin, it will fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if it’s from God, you won’t be able to stop them. You may even discover that you’re fighting against God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The council took his advice. They called the apostles, beat them, ordered them not to speak about the one named Yeshua, and let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles left the council room. They were happy to have been considered worthy to suffer dishonor for speaking about Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day in the temple courtyard and from house to house, they refused to stop teaching and telling the Good News that Yeshua is the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, as the number of disciples grew, Greek-speaking Jews complained about the Hebrew-speaking Jews. The Greek-speaking Jews claimed that the widows among them were neglected every day when food and other assistance was distributed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelve apostles called all the disciples together and told them, “It’s not right for us to give up God’s word in order to distribute food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, brothers and sisters, choose seven men whom the people know are spiritually wise. We will put them in charge of this problem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, we will devote ourselves to praying and to serving in ways that are related to the word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The suggestion pleased the whole group. So they chose Stephen, who was a man full of faith and the Holy Spirit, and they chose Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolaus, who had converted to Judaism in the city of Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples had these men stand in front of the apostles, who prayed and placed their hands on these seven men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of God continued to spread, and the number of disciples in Jerusalem grew very large. A large number of priests accepted the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stephen was a man filled with God’s favor and power. He did amazing things and performed miracles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day some men from the cities of Cyrene and Alexandria and the provinces of Cilicia and Asia started an argument with Stephen. They belonged to a synagogue called Freedmen’s Synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They couldn’t argue with Stephen because he spoke with the wisdom that the Spirit had given him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they bribed some men to lie.
These men said, “We heard him slander Moses and God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The liars stirred up trouble among the people, the leaders, and the experts in Moses’ Teachings. So they went to Stephen, took him by force, and brought him in front of the Jewish council.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some witnesses stood up and lied about Stephen. They said, “This man never stops saying bad things about the holy place and Moses’ Teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We heard him say that Yeshua from Nazareth will destroy the temple and change the customs that Moses gave us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who sat in the council stared at him and saw that his face looked like an angel’s face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priest asked Stephen, “Is this true?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stephen answered, “Brothers and fathers, listen to me. The God who reveals his glory appeared to our ancestor Abraham in Mesopotamia. This happened before Abraham lived in Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God told him, ‘Leave your land and your relatives. Go to the land that I will show you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then Abraham left the country of Chaldea and lived in the city of Haran. After his father died, God made him move from there to this land where we now live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet, God didn’t give Abraham anything in this land to call his own, not even a place to rest his feet. But God promised to give this land to him and to his descendants, even though Abraham didn’t have a child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God told Abraham that his descendants would be foreigners living in another country and that the people there would make them slaves and mistreat them for 400 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God also told him, ‘I will punish the people whom they will serve. After that, they will leave that country and worship me here.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “God gave Abraham circumcision to confirm his promise. So when Abraham’s son Isaac was born, Abraham circumcised him on the eighth day. Isaac did the same to his son Jacob, and Jacob did the same to his twelve sons (the ancestors of our tribes).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jacob’s sons were jealous of their brother Joseph. They sold him into slavery, and he was taken to Egypt. But God was with Joseph
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and rescued him from all his suffering. When Joseph stood in the presence of Pharaoh (the king of Egypt), God gave Joseph divine favor and wisdom so that he became ruler of Egypt and of Pharaoh’s whole palace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a famine throughout Egypt and Canaan brought a lot of suffering. Our ancestors couldn’t find any food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jacob heard that Egypt had food, he sent our ancestors there. That was their first trip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the second trip, Joseph told his brothers who he was, and Pharaoh learned about Joseph’s family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph sent for his father Jacob and his relatives, 75 people in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob went to Egypt, and he and our ancestors died there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were taken to Shechem for burial in the tomb that Abraham purchased in Shechem from Hamor’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the time that God had promised to Abraham had almost come, the number of our people in Egypt had grown very large.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a different king, who knew nothing about Joseph, began to rule in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This king was shrewd in the way he took advantage of our people. He mistreated our ancestors. He made them abandon their newborn babies outdoors, where they would die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time Moses was born, and he was a very beautiful child. His parents took care of him for three months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses was abandoned outdoors, Pharaoh’s daughter adopted him and raised him as her son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and became a great man in what he said and did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was 40 years old, he decided to visit his own people, the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw an Israelite man being treated unfairly by an Egyptian, he defended the Israelite. He took revenge by killing the Egyptian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses thought his own people would understand that God was going to use him to give them freedom. But they didn’t understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day Moses saw two Israelites fighting, and he tried to make peace between them. He said to them, ‘Men, you are brothers. Why are you treating each other unfairly?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But one of the men pushed Moses aside. He asked Moses, ‘Who made you our ruler and judge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you want to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he said that, Moses quickly left Egypt and lived in Midian as a foreigner. In Midian he fathered two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Forty years later, a Messenger appeared to him in the flames of a burning bush in the desert of Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was surprised when he saw this. As he went closer to look at the bush, the voice of the Lord said to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of your ancestors—the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.’ Moses began to tremble and didn’t dare to look at the bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told him, ‘Take off your sandals. The place where you’re standing is holy ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ve seen how my people are mistreated in Egypt. I’ve heard their groaning and have come to rescue them. So now I’m sending you to Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the Moses whom the Israelites rejected by saying, ‘Who made you our ruler and judge?’ This is the one God sent to free them and to rule them with the help of the Messenger who appeared to him in the bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the man who led our ancestors out of Egypt. He is the person who did amazing things and worked miracles in Egypt, at the Red Sea, and in the desert for 40 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the same Moses who told the Israelites, ‘God will send you a prophet, an Israelite like me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the Moses who was in the assembly in the desert. Our ancestors and the Messenger who spoke to him on Mount Sinai were there with him. Moses received life-giving messages to give to us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but our ancestors were not willing to obey him. Instead, they pushed him aside, and in their hearts they turned back to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told Aaron, ‘We don’t know what has happened to this Moses, who led us out of Egypt. So make gods who will lead us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That was the time they made a calf. They offered a sacrifice to that false god and delighted in what they had made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So God turned away from them and let them worship the sun, moon, and stars. This is written in the book of the prophets: ‘Did you bring me sacrifices and grain offerings in the desert for 40 years, nation of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You carried along the shrine of Moloch, the star of the god Rephan, and the statues you made for yourselves to worship. I will send you into exile beyond the city of Babylon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In the desert our ancestors had the tent of God’s promise. Moses built this tent exactly as God had told him. He used the model he had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After our ancestors received the tent, they brought it into this land. They did this with Joshua’s help when they took possession of the land from the nations that God forced out of our ancestors’ way. This tent remained here until the time of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who won God’s favor. David asked that he might provide a permanent place for the family of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Solomon was the one who built a house for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, the Most High doesn’t live in a house built by humans, as the prophet says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The Lord says,
    “Heaven is my throne.
    The earth is my footstool.
        What kind of house are you going to build for me?
        Where will I rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Didn’t I make all these things?” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How stubborn can you be? How can you be so heartless and disobedient? You’re just like your ancestors. They always opposed the Holy Spirit, and so do you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was there ever a prophet your ancestors didn’t persecute? They killed those who predicted that a man with God’s approval would come. You have now become the people who betrayed and murdered that man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are the people who received Moses’ Teachings, which were put into effect by angels. But you haven’t obeyed those teachings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As council members listened to Stephen, they became noticeably furious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Stephen was full of the Holy Spirit. He looked into heaven, saw God’s glory, and Yeshua in the position of authority that God gives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Stephen said, “Look, I see heaven opened and the Son of Man in the position of authority that God has given him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the council members shouted and refused to listen. Then they rushed at Stephen with one purpose in mind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after they had thrown him out of the city, they began to stone him to death. The witnesses left their coats with a young man named Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While council members were executing Stephen, he called out, “Lord Yeshua, welcome my spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he knelt down and shouted, “Lord, don’t hold this sin against them.” After he had said this, he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saul approved of putting Stephen to death.
On that day widespread persecution broke out against the church in Jerusalem. Most believers, except the apostles, were scattered throughout Judea and Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Devout men buried Stephen as they mourned loudly for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul tried to destroy the church. He dragged men and women out of one home after another and threw them into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The believers who were scattered went from place to place, where they spread the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip went to the city of Samaria and told people about the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowds paid close attention to what Philip said. They listened to him and saw the miracles that he performed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Evil spirits screamed as they came out of the many people they had possessed. Many paralyzed and lame people were cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, that city was extremely happy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man named Simon lived in that city. He amazed the people of Samaria with his practice of magic. He claimed that he was great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone from children to adults paid attention to him. They said, “This man is the power of God, and that power is called great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They paid attention to Simon because he had amazed them for a long time with his practice of magic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, when Philip spread the Good News about the kingdom of God and the one named Yeshua Christ, men and women believed him and were baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even Simon believed, and after he was baptized, he became devoted to Philip. Simon was amazed to see the miracles and impressive things that were happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the apostles in Jerusalem heard that the Samaritans had accepted the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter and John went to Samaria and prayed that the Samaritans would receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Before this the Holy Spirit had not come to any of the Samaritans. They had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Yeshua.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter and John placed their hands on them, and the Samaritans received the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon saw that the Spirit was given to the Samaritans when the apostles placed their hands on them. So he offered Peter and John money
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Give me this power so that anyone I place my hands on will receive the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter told Simon, “May your money be destroyed with you because you thought you could buy God’s gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You won’t have any share in this because God can see how twisted your thinking is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So change your wicked thoughts, and ask the Lord if he will forgive you for thinking like this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can see that you are bitter with jealousy and wrapped up in your evil ways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered, “Pray to the Lord for me that none of the things you said will happen to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had boldly spoken about the message of the Lord, they spread the Good News in many Samaritan villages on their way back to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel from the Lord said to Philip, “Get up, and take the desert road that goes south from Jerusalem to Gaza.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Philip went.
An Ethiopian man who had come to Jerusalem to worship was on his way home. The man was a eunuch, a high-ranking official in charge of all the treasures of Queen Candace of Ethiopia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the official rode along in his carriage, he was reading the prophet Isaiah out loud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit said to Philip, “Go to that carriage, and stay close to it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip ran to the carriage and could hear the official reading the prophet Isaiah out loud. Philip asked him, “Do you understand what you’re reading?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The official answered, “How can I understand unless someone guides me?” So he invited Philip to sit with him in his carriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This was the part of the Scriptures that the official was reading:
“He was led like a lamb to the slaughter.
    He was like a sheep that is silent
    when its wool is cut off.
        He didn’t open his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he humbled himself,
    he was not judged fairly.
    Who from his generation
    will talk about his life on earth being cut short?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The official said to Philip, “I would like to know who the prophet is talking about. Is he talking about himself or someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Philip spoke. Starting with that passage, Philip told the official the Good News about Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were going along the road, they came to some water. The official said to Philip, “Look, there’s some water. What can keep me from being baptized?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The official ordered the carriage to stop. He and Philip stepped into the water, and Philip baptized him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had stepped out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord suddenly took Philip away. The official joyfully continued on his way and didn’t see Philip again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip found himself in the city of Azotus. He traveled through all the cities and spread the Good News until he came to the city of Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul kept threatening to murder the Lord’s disciples. He went to the chief priest
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked him to write letters of authorization to the synagogue leaders in the city of Damascus. Saul wanted to arrest any man or woman who followed the way of Christ and imprison them in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Saul was coming near the city of Damascus, a light from heaven suddenly flashed around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fell to the ground and heard a voice say to him, “Saul! Saul! Why are you persecuting me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saul asked, “Who are you, sir?”
The person replied, “I’m Yeshua, the one you’re persecuting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up! Go into the city, and you’ll be told what you should do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the men traveling with him were speechless. They heard the voice but didn’t see anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul was helped up from the ground. When he opened his eyes, he was blind. So his companions led him into Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For three days he couldn’t see and didn’t eat or drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A disciple named Ananias lived in the city of Damascus. The Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias!”
Ananias answered, “Yes, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told him, “Get up! Go to Judas’ house on Straight Street, and ask for a man named Saul from the city of Tarsus. He’s praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a vision he has seen a man named Ananias place his hands on him to restore his sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ananias replied, “Lord, I’ve heard a lot of people tell about the many evil things this man has done to your people in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul has come here to Damascus with authority from the chief priests to put anyone who calls on your name in prison.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Ananias, “Go! I’ve chosen this man to bring my name to nations, to kings, and to the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll show him how much he has to suffer for the sake of my name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ananias left and entered Judas’ house. After he placed his hands on Saul, Ananias said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Yeshua, who appeared to you on your way to Damascus, sent me to you. He wants you to see again and to be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, something like fish scales fell from Saul’s eyes, and he could see again. Then Saul stood up and was baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After he had something to eat, his strength came back to him.
Saul was with the disciples in the city of Damascus for several days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He immediately began to spread the word in their synagogues that Yeshua was the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who heard him was amazed. They asked, “Isn’t this the man who destroyed those who worshiped the one named Yeshua in Jerusalem? Didn’t he come here to take these worshipers as prisoners to the chief priests in Jerusalem?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul grew more powerful, and he confused the Jews living in Damascus by proving that Yeshua was the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later the Jews planned to murder Saul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Saul was told about their plot. They were watching the city gates day and night in order to murder him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Saul’s disciples lowered him in a large basket through an opening in the wall one night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Saul arrived in Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples. But everyone was afraid of him. They wouldn’t believe that he was a disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Barnabas took an interest in Saul and brought him to the apostles. Barnabas told the apostles how Saul had seen the Lord on the road and that the Lord had spoken to him. Barnabas also told them how boldly Saul had spoken about the one named Yeshua in the city of Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul went throughout Jerusalem with the disciples. He spoke boldly with the power and authority of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He talked and argued with Greek-speaking Jews, but they tried to murder him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the disciples found out about this, they took Saul to Caesarea and sent him to Tarsus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the church throughout Judea, Galilee, and Samaria had peace. The number of people increased as people lived in the fear of the Lord and the comfort of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter was going around to all of God’s people, he came to those who lived in the city of Lydda.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Lydda Peter found a man named Aeneas who was paralyzed and confined to a cot for eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Yeshua Christ makes you well. Get up, and pick up your cot.” Aeneas immediately got up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who lived in the city of Lydda and the coastal region of Sharon saw what had happened to Aeneas and turned to the Lord in faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A disciple named Tabitha lived in the city of Joppa. Her Greek name was Dorcas. She always helped people and gave things to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She became sick and died. Her body was prepared for burial and was laid in an upstairs room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lydda is near the city of Joppa. When the disciples heard that Peter was in Lydda, they sent two men to him. They begged Peter, “Hurry to Joppa! We need your help!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter went with them. When he arrived, he was taken upstairs. All the widows stood around him. They were crying and showing Peter the articles of clothing that Dorcas had made while she was still with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter made everyone leave the room.
He knelt and prayed. Then he turned toward the body and said, “Tabitha, get up!”
Tabitha opened her eyes, saw Peter, and sat up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter took her hand and helped her stand up. After he called the believers, especially the widows, he presented Tabitha to them. She was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The news about this spread throughout the city of Joppa, and as a result, many people believed in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter stayed in Joppa for a number of days with Simon, a leatherworker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man named Cornelius lived in the city of Caesarea. He was a Roman army officer in the Italian Regiment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He and everyone in his home were devout and respected God. Cornelius gave many gifts to poor Jewish people and always prayed to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, about three in the afternoon, he had a vision. He clearly saw an angel from God come to him and say, “Cornelius!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stared at the angel and was terrified. Cornelius asked the angel, “What do you want, sir?”
The angel answered him, “God is aware of your prayers and your gifts to the poor, and he has remembered you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send messengers now to the city of Joppa, and summon a man whose name is Simon Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is a guest of Simon, a leatherworker, whose house is by the sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying this, the angel left. Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier, one of those who served him regularly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cornelius explained everything to them and sent them to Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Around noon the next day, while Cornelius’ men were on their way and coming close to Joppa, Peter went on the roof to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He became hungry and wanted to eat. While the food was being prepared, he fell into a trance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw the sky open and something like a large linen sheet being lowered by its four corners to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the sheet were all kinds of four-footed animals, reptiles, and birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice told him, “Get up, Peter! Kill these animals, and eat them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter answered, “I can’t do that, Lord! I’ve never eaten anything that is impure or unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice spoke to him a second time, “Don’t say that the things which God has made clean are impure.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened three times. Then the sheet was quickly taken into the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was puzzled by the meaning of the vision, the men sent by Cornelius found Simon’s house and went to the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked if Simon Peter was staying there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter was still thinking about the vision when the Spirit said to him, “Three men are looking for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up, and go downstairs. Don’t hesitate to go with these men. I have sent them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter went to the men. He said, “I’m the man you’re looking for. Why are you here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men replied, “Cornelius, a Roman army officer, sent us. He’s a man who has God’s approval and who respects God. Also, the Jewish people respect him. A holy angel told him to summon you to his home to hear what you have to say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter asked the men to come into the house and had them stay overnight.
The next day Peter left with them. Some disciples from Joppa went along.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following day they arrived in Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called his relatives and close friends together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter was about to enter Cornelius’ house, Cornelius met him, bowed down, and worshiped Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter made him get up. He told him, “Stand up! I’m only a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Peter talked, he entered Cornelius’ house and found that many people had gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You understand how wrong it is for a Jewish man to associate or visit with anyone of another race. But God has shown me that I should no longer call anyone impure or unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why I didn’t object to coming here when you sent for me. I want to know why you sent for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cornelius answered, “Four days ago I was praying at home. It was at this same time, three o’clock in the afternoon. Suddenly, a man dressed in radiant clothes stood in front of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, ‘Cornelius, God has heard your prayer and has remembered your gifts to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So send messengers to Joppa, and summon a man whose name is Simon Peter. He’s a guest in the home of Simon, a leatherworker who lives by the sea.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I sent for you immediately. Thank you for coming. All of us are here now in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has ordered you to say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said, “Now I understand that God doesn’t play favorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, whoever respects God and does what is right is acceptable to him in any nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God sent his word to the people of Israel and brought them the Good News of peace through Yeshua Christ. This Yeshua Christ is everyone’s Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know what happened throughout Judea. Everything began in Galilee after John spread the news about baptism.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that God anointed Yeshua from Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power. Yeshua went everywhere and did good things, such as healing everyone who was under the devil’s power. Yeshua did these things because God was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We can testify to everything Yeshua did in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem. People hung him on a cross and killed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but God brought him back to life on the third day. God didn’t show him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to all the people. He showed Yeshua to witnesses, apostles he had already chosen. We apostles are those men who ate and drank with Yeshua after he came back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ordered us to warn the people, ‘God has appointed Yeshua to judge the living and the dead.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In addition, all the prophets testify that people who believe in the one named Yeshua receive forgiveness for their sins through him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was still speaking, the Holy Spirit came to everyone who heard his message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the believers who were circumcised and who had come with Peter were amazed that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured on people who were not Jewish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They heard these non-Jewish people speaking in other languages and praising God.
Then Peter said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one can refuse to baptize these people with water. They have received the Holy Spirit in the same way that we did.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Peter ordered that they should be baptized in the name of Yeshua Christ.
Then they asked Peter to stay with them for several days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles and the believers throughout Judea heard that people who were not Jewish had accepted God’s word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, when Peter went to Jerusalem, the believers who insisted on circumcision began to argue with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “You went to visit men who were uncircumcised, and you even ate with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began to explain to them point by point what had happened. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I was praying in the city of Joppa when I fell into a trance. I saw something like a large linen sheet being lowered by its four corners from the sky. The sheet came near me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I looked into the sheet very closely and saw tame animals, wild animals, reptiles, and birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also heard a voice telling me, ‘Get up, Peter! Kill these animals, and eat them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I answered, ‘I can’t do that, Lord! I’ve never put anything impure or unclean into my mouth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A voice spoke from heaven a second time, ‘Don’t say that the things which God has made clean are impure.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened three times. Then everything was pulled back into the sky again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that moment three men arrived at the house where we were staying. They had been sent from Caesarea to find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit told me to go with them without any hesitation. Six believers from Joppa went with me, and we visited Cornelius’ home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He told us that he had seen an angel standing in his home. The angel told him, ‘Send messengers to Joppa, and summon a man whose name is Simon Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will give you a message that will save you and everyone in your home.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When I began to speak, the Holy Spirit came to these people. This was the same thing that happened to us in the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I remembered that the Lord had said, ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized by the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they believed, God gave them the same gift that he gave us when we believed in the Lord Yeshua Christ. So who was I to interfere with God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the others heard this, they had no further objections. They praised God by saying, “Then God has also led people who are not Jewish to turn to him so that they can change the way they think and act and have eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the believers who were scattered by the trouble that broke out following Stephen’s death went as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and the city of Antioch. They spoke God’s word only to Jewish people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But other believers, who were from Cyprus and Cyrene, arrived in Antioch. They started to spread the Good News about the Lord Yeshua to Greeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord’s power was with his followers, and a large number of people believed and turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the news about Antioch reached the church in Jerusalem, Barnabas was sent to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arrived there, he was pleased to see what God had done for them out of kindness. So he encouraged all the people to remain solidly committed to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Barnabas was a dependable man, and he was full of the Holy Spirit and faith. A large crowd believed in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Barnabas left Antioch to go to the city of Tarsus to look for Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After finding Saul, Barnabas brought him back to Antioch. Barnabas and Saul met with the church in Antioch for a whole year and taught a large group of people. The disciples were called Christians for the first time in the city of Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time some prophets came from Jerusalem to the city of Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them was named Agabus. Through the Spirit Agabus predicted that a severe famine would affect the entire world. This happened while Claudius was emperor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the disciples in Antioch decided to contribute whatever they could afford to help the believers living in Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples did this and sent their contribution with Barnabas and Saul to the leaders in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About that time King Herod devoted his attention to mistreating certain members of the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had James, the brother of John, executed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw how this pleased the Jews, he arrested Peter too. This happened during the days of Unleavened Bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After capturing Peter, Herod had him thrown into prison with sixteen soldiers in squads of four to guard him. Herod wanted to bring Peter to trial in front of the people after Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter was kept in prison, but the church was praying very hard to God for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The night before Herod was going to bring Peter to trial, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers. His hands were bound with two chains, and guards were in front of the door. They were watching the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, an angel from the Lord stood near Peter, and his cell was filled with light. The angel nudged Peter’s side, woke him up, and said, “Hurry! Get up!” At that moment the chains fell from Peter’s hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel told him, “Put your shoes on, and get ready to go!” Peter did this. Then the angel told him, “Put your coat on, and follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter followed the angel out of the cell. He didn’t realize that what the angel was doing was actually happening. He thought he was seeing a vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They passed the first and second guardposts and came to the iron gate that led into the city. This gate opened by itself for them, so they went outside and up the street. The angel suddenly left Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter came to his senses, he said, “Now I’m sure that the Lord sent his angel to rescue me from Herod and from everything the Jewish people are expecting to happen to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter realized what had happened, he went to the home of Mary, the mother of John Mark. Many people had gathered at her home and were praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter knocked on the door of the entryway, and a servant named Rhoda came to answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she recognized Peter’s voice, she was so happy that instead of opening the door, she ran back inside and reported, “Peter is standing at the door!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people told her, “You’re crazy!” But she insisted that Peter was at the door. They said, “It has to be his angel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter kept knocking. When they opened the door, they were shocked to see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter motioned with his hand to quiet them down and told them how the Lord had taken him out of prison. He added, “Tell James and the other believers about this.” Then he left and went somewhere else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning the soldiers were in an uproar over what had happened to Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Herod searched for Peter but couldn’t find him. So he questioned the guards and gave orders to have them executed.
Then Herod left Judea and went to Caesarea, where he stayed for a while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon. They were going to meet with Herod. They had agreed on what they wanted to do: They enlisted the help of Blastus to ask Herod for terms of peace. This was because their cities depended on Herod for their food supply. (Blastus was in charge of the king’s living quarters.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The appointed day came. Herod, wearing his royal clothes, sat on his throne and began making a speech to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people started shouting, “The voice of a god and not of a man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, an angel from the Lord killed Herod for not giving glory to God. Herod was eaten by maggots, and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God’s word continued to spread and win many followers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Barnabas and Saul delivered the contribution to the leaders in Jerusalem, they returned to Antioch from Jerusalem. They brought John Mark with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Barnabas, Simeon (called the Black), Lucius (from Cyrene), Manaen (a close friend of Herod since childhood), and Saul were prophets and teachers in the church in Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set Barnabas and Saul apart for me. I want them to do the work for which I called them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After fasting and praying, Simeon, Lucius, and Manaen placed their hands on Barnabas and Saul, and released them from their work in Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Barnabas and Saul were sent by the Holy Spirit, they went to the city of Seleucia and from there sailed to the island of Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arriving in the city of Salamis, they began to spread God’s word in the synagogues. John Mark had gone along to help them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They went through the whole island as far as the city of Paphos.
In Paphos they met a Jewish man named Barjesus. He was an astrologer who claimed to be a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was associated with an intelligent man, Sergius Paulus, who was the governor of the island. The governor sent for Barnabas and Saul because he wanted to hear the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elymas, whose name means astrologer, opposed them and tried to distort the meaning of the faith so that the governor wouldn’t believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul, also known as Paul, was filled with the Holy Spirit. He stared at Elymas
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “You are full of dirty tricks and schemes, you son of the devil! You hate everything that has God’s approval. Quit trying to distort the truth about the way the Lord wants people to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is against you now. For a while you will be blind, unable to see the light of day.”
Suddenly, Elymas couldn’t see a thing. He tried to find people to lead him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the governor saw what had happened, he believed. The Lord’s teachings amazed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul and his men took a ship from Paphos and arrived in Perga, a city in Pamphylia. John Mark deserted them there and went back to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul and Barnabas left Perga and arrived in Antioch, a city near Pisidia. On the day of worship they went into the synagogue and sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After reading from Moses’ Teachings and the Prophets, the synagogue leaders sent a message to Paul and Barnabas. The message said, “Brothers, if you have any words of encouragement for the people, feel free to speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul stood up, motioned with his hand, and said, “Men of Israel and converts to Judaism, listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of the people of Israel chose our ancestors and made them a strong nation while they lived as foreigners in Egypt. He used his powerful arm to bring them out of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he put up with them for about forty years in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he destroyed seven nations in Canaan and gave their land to his people as an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He did all this in about four hundred and fifty years.
“After that he gave his people judges until the time of the prophet Samuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the people demanded a king, so God gave them Saul, son of Kish, from the tribe of Benjamin. After forty years
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God removed Saul and made David their king. God spoke favorably about David. He said, ‘I have found that David, son of Jesse, is a man after my own heart. He will do everything I want him to do.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “God had the Savior, Yeshua, come to Israel from David’s descendants, as he had promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before Yeshua began his ministry, John the Baptizer told everyone in Israel about the baptism of repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John was finishing his work, he said, ‘Who do you think I am? I’m not the person you’re looking for. He will come later. I’m not even good enough to untie his sandals.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brothers—descendants of Abraham and converts to Judaism—the message that God saves people was sent to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people who live in Jerusalem and their rulers didn’t know who Yeshua was. They didn’t understand the prophets’ messages, which are read every day of worship. So they condemned Yeshua and fulfilled what the prophets had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although they couldn’t find any good reason to kill him, they asked Pilate to have him executed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had finished doing everything that was written about him, they took him down from the cross and placed him in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God brought him back to life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for many days he appeared to those who had come with him to Jerusalem from Galilee. These people are now witnesses and are testifying to the Jewish people about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are telling you the Good News: What God promised our ancestors has happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has fulfilled the promise for us, their descendants, by bringing Yeshua back to life. This is what Scripture says in the second psalm:
‘You are my Son.
    Today I have become your Father.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “God stated that he brought Yeshua back to life and that Yeshua’s body never decayed. He said, ‘I will give you the enduring love promised to David.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another psalm says, ‘You will not allow your holy one to decay.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After doing God’s will by serving the people of his time, David died. He was laid to rest with his ancestors, but his body decayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the man God brought back to life had a body that didn’t decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So, brothers, I’m telling you that through Yeshua your sins can be forgiven. Sins kept you from receiving God’s approval through Moses’ Teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, everyone who believes in Yeshua receives God’s approval.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be careful, or what the prophets said may happen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Look, you mockers!
    Be amazed and die!
    I am going to do something in your days
        that you would not believe even if it were reported to you!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue, the people invited them to speak on the same subject the next day of worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the meeting of the synagogue broke up, many Jews and converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas. Paul and Barnabas talked with them and were persuading them to continue trusting God’s good will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day of worship, almost the whole city gathered to hear the Lord’s word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Jews saw the crowds, they became very jealous. They used insulting language to contradict whatever Paul said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul and Barnabas told them boldly, “We had to speak the word of God to you first. Since you reject the word and consider yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, we are now going to turn to people of other nations.
